messages.subject: Re: [AlwaysLearning] Reminder!
messages.msgSnippet: -=-We love getting letters and e-mails from you! Especially when you tell us that something you saw on the show changed your life...-=- (The description of the
messages.messageBody:
-=-We love getting letters and e-mails from you! Especially when you tell us
that something you saw on the show changed your life...-=-


(The description of the Oprah show for Tuesday/today/11/26)

Mary said they might only be in the front row. Any updates now that it's
been taped?

It wasn't going to be about homeschooling, but about the show with Jamie Lee
Curtis talking about body image changing the way Mary felt about and treated
her daughter, I think.

Sandra

messages.subject: Re: [AlwaysLearning] Reminder!
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 11/25/02 10:14:58 PM Central Standard Time, ... Thanks Ren. You are very sweet, and you made my day! Ugh, what a bad day I had. :o(  What is
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 11/25/02 10:14:58 PM Central Standard Time,
starsuncloud@... writes:

> Don't forget, Mary B and her daughter Tara are going to be on Oprah
> tomorrow.
> Also, I forgot to tell Nancy HAPPY BIRTHDAY (belated that is). I was
> supposed to remind everyone on the 15th, the real day of celebrating
> her birth, but I totally ignored the note on my computer (doh!!).
> So Happy Birthday Nancy!! The world is a better place with you here.
>
> And I can't wait to see Mary B live!
>
> Ren

Thanks Ren. You are very sweet, and you made my day! Ugh, what a bad day I
had. :o( What is on Oprah tomorrow? Rather, why are Mary and her daughter
going to be on? Unschooling on Oprah?
~Nancy


[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]

messages.subject: Reminder!
messages.msgSnippet: Don t forget, Mary B and her daughter Tara are going to be on Oprah tomorrow. Also, I forgot to tell Nancy HAPPY BIRTHDAY (belated that is). I was supposed to
messages.messageBody:
Don't forget, Mary B and her daughter Tara are going to be on Oprah
tomorrow.
Also, I forgot to tell Nancy HAPPY BIRTHDAY (belated that is). I was
supposed to remind everyone on the 15th, the real day of celebrating
her birth, but I totally ignored the note on my computer (doh!!).
So Happy Birthday Nancy!! The world is a better place with you here.

And I can't wait to see Mary B live!

Ren
